author: travelandtourworld.com
title: UNESCO Rhön Biosphere Reserve, one of the best places in Europe for star gazingTravelandtourworld.com
text:
UNESCO Rhön Biosphere Reserve, one of the best places in Europe for star gazing Published on : Wednesday, August 19, 2015
The UNESCO Rhön Biosphere Reserve, which is located at the border of Hessen, Bavaria and Thuringia, is one of the best places anywhere in Europe for star gazing.
In 2014 the Sternenpark Rhön was designated an international ‘star park’ by the International Dark Sky Association. This is because the sky above the biosphere reserve is particularly dark at night, allowing you to see the stars without the effects of light pollution.
Why not visit the Rhön Biosphere Reserve for an astronomy-themed walk and discover celestial wonders in the company of a qualified guide?
The Rhön hills are also well worth exploring by day. Among the many exciting activities on offer are ranger-led tours of the moors, llama trekking, wild cat walks, climbing tours and even craft and farmers markets.
Source: GNTB
